meanings.definition: The cancellation of a debt, charge, or penalty.
meanings.sent1: After his hard work, he received a remission of his fine.
meanings.sent2: The judge granted a remission of the parking ticket.
meanings.sent3: The remission of the library fee made him smile.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a remission of the debt he owed.
meanings.sent5: The remission of the late fee was a relief for the student.

meanings.definition: The temporary diminution of the severity of a disease or its symptoms.
meanings.sent1: With proper treatment, the patient experienced a remission of the illness.
meanings.sent2: The doctor noted a remission in the patient's symptoms.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected remission of the flu surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: The remission of the fever brought hope to the family.
meanings.sent5: The sudden remission of pain was a welcome change for the patient.

meanings.sent1: Through prayer, he sought remission for his mistakes.
meanings.sent2: The priest offered remission to those who confessed.
meanings.sent3: The remission of sins brought peace to his heart.
meanings.sent4: Her act of kindness was a remission of his wrongdoings.
meanings.sent5: The remission of guilt lifted a weight off his shoulders.
